competitors.name: GitHub
competitors.notes: Primary competitor, owned by Microsoft since 2018, dominant in open source

competitors.name: Atlassian Bitbucket
competitors.notes: Git repository integrated with Jira and Confluence

competitors.name: Azure DevOps
competitors.notes: Microsoft's DevOps platform with Azure integration

context: In 2020, GitLab positioned itself as an all-in-one DevOps platform competing against Microsoft's GitHub (acquired 2018 for $7.5B). The pandemic accelerated DevOps adoption as remote development became standard. GitLab's integrated CI/CD was a key differentiator versus GitHub's GitHub Actions. The company was still private, preparing for its 2021 IPO. Competition focused on complete DevOps lifecycle versus best-of-breed tool combinations.
